questions.text: Physical capability exceeding daily requirements is ...

answers.4: substantial — I have reserves for unexpected demands
answers.5: abundant — significant capacity beyond what I need
answers.2: minimal — barely enough for daily life
answers.3: moderate — enough for normal days, tight for hard ones
answers.1: absent — I struggle with basic demands

questions.text: Capacity to physically help others (move, lift, serve) is ...

answers.4: good — I can be genuinely useful physically
answers.5: substantial — I have real capacity to serve others physically
answers.2: limited — I can help a little but it costs me
answers.3: moderate — I can help with some things
answers.1: absent — I can barely help myself

questions.text: Physical options (hiking, travel, play, physical work) available to me are ...

answers.4: good — most activities are available to me
answers.5: wide open — my fitness gives me many options
answers.2: constrained — many activities are off limits
answers.1: very limited — my body restricts what I can do

questions.text: Building physical capacity vs. just maintaining or losing it is ...

answers.4: usually building — I'm investing more than spending
answers.5: consistently building — I'm growing stronger over time
answers.2: barely maintaining — fighting to stay even

questions.text: Energy left at the end of the day is ...

answers.4: usually there — I end most days with something left
answers.5: consistent — I rarely end a day depleted
answers.1: nonexistent — I'm completely depleted by normal activities
